com.pump.io.location

Class ArchiveLocation<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.io.location.IOLocation
      • com.pump.io.location.ArchiveLocation<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - an object describing each archive entry. For example: a ZipEntry or TarEntry.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TarArchiveLocation, ZipArchiveLocation

    public abstract class ArchiveLocation<T>
extends IOLocation
    This represents an archive and all of its children.

    This abstract superclass manages the tree structure and loading logic for subclasses. The loading is executed in a separated thread, but when there are no entities waiting for information about an archive: that thread is cancelled.

    Both the root node (which doesn't have an ArchiveEntry) and all child nodes (which do) are represented with this class. This design choice introduces some inner complexity, but it was to simplify developer's interaction with this class. (That is: now they can just check if(x instanceof TarArchiveLocation) without worrying about whether an IOLocation might really resemble ArchiveLocation$NodeSubclass.)

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • isNavigable

        public boolean isNavigable()
        Description copied from class: IOLocation
        This indicates if the user is encouraged to navigate inside this location.

        For example, on Macs certain folders end in ".app". Although technically these are directories, users shouldn't navigate inside them.

        Also: archive files (like the ZipArchiveLocation) are a file (and not a directory), but they are navigable.

        By default this returns isDirectory(), but if omitMacBundles is true this will return false if this location's name ends with a suffix like ".app".

        Overrides:
        isNavigable in class IOLocation
        Returns:
        true if this resource is a directory that should be navigable.
        See Also:
        IOLocation.omitMacBundles

      • getArchiveEntry

        public final T getArchiveEntry()
        Return a description of this archive entry. This will return null for the root container.

      • getPath

        public final java.lang.String getPath()
        Description copied from class: IOLocation
        This returns a unique path for this location. This could be used for sorting, hashtables, or otherwise uniquely identifying this object.

        Note this needs to uniquely the path, so different location types should include their unique prefixes. (a file-based location should start with something like "file://", and a ftp-based location should start with "ftp://", etc.)

        Specified by:
        getPath in class IOLocation

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Description copied from class: IOLocation
        This returns the file name of this location.

        This should be the end of getPath().

        Specified by:
        getName in class IOLocation

      • setParent

      • getChild

        public final IOLocation getChild(java.lang.String name)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: IOLocation
        This returns a reference to a child of this location. This may return null if this location cannot contain children (either because it is a file and not a directory, or because it is a directory that doesn't have write privileges).

        Also note that this can return a child that does not exist.

        The default implementation only polls existing children: subclasses are encouraged to override this to return locations that do not yet exist.

        Overrides:
        getChild in class IOLocation
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the child.
        Returns:
        the child requested, or null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

      • mkdir

        public final void mkdir()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: IOLocation
        Creates a directory at this location. This will throw an exception if a file already exists at this location.
        Specified by:
        mkdir in class IOLocation
        Throws:
        IOLocation.MakeDirectoryException - if an error occurs making a directory.
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

      • getURL

        public final java.net.URL getURL()
        Description copied from class: IOLocation
        If possible this will return a URL pointing to this location. This may return null if no such URL exists. (For example: a collection of search results is a directory of valid IOLocations that does not have a URL.)
        Specified by:
        getURL in class IOLocation
        Returns:
        a URL to this location, if it exists.

      • setName

        public IOLocation setName(java.lang.String s)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: IOLocation
        This changes the name of this location. If there are resources currently at this location: those resources should be moved if getName().equals(s) is false and no exceptions occur.

        This method is not capable of moving a resource to another directory structure.

        Specified by:
        setName in class IOLocation
        Parameters:
        s - the name name of this resource.
        Returns:
        the new IOLocation the resource formerly at this location can now be accessed from.
        Throws:
        IOLocation.SetNameException - if an error occurred renaming this file.
        java.io.IOException - if an IO problem occurs.

      • exists

        public final boolean exists()
        Description copied from class: IOLocation
        Indicates whether this resource exists.

        Generally IOLocation objects are hard to come across if they aren't associated with a resource, but if you delete or rename a location successfully this will return false.

        Specified by:
        exists in class IOLocation
        Returns:
        true if this location represents a resource that exists.

      • listChildren

        public IOLocation[] listChildren(Receiver<IOLocation> receiver,
                                 BasicCancellable cancellable)
        Description copied from class: IOLocation
        This lists the children of this directory.
        Specified by:
        listChildren in class IOLocation
        Parameters:
        receiver - an optional Receiver to be notified as each child is processed.
        cancellable - an optional Cancellable. If non-null: classes that extend this class should constantly poll it to see if isCancelled() is true.
        Returns:
        all the children (if any) of this object. This should not return null, but may return an empty array for non-directories.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • createDirectory

        protected abstract T createDirectory(java.lang.String path)
        This is invoked when the root node is cataloging the contents of an archive and it comes across "abc/foo.jpg" before there is a directory titled "abc". We'd much rather have a separate archive entry for the "abc" directory (so we can correctly define all the meta info), but this runner-up approach still gets the job done.
        Parameters:
        path - the full archive path name of a directory we need to catalog a file.
        Returns:
        an archive entry representing that path name.

      • getSeparatorChar

        protected abstract char getSeparatorChar()
        Return the character that archive path names treat as a separator.

                                    throws java.io.IOException
        List all the archive entries.

        This is only invoked on the root ArchiveLocation.

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • getGroup

        public IOLocationGroup getGroup()
        Description copied from class: IOLocation
        This may return a group shared between related IOLocations. For example: if this location is accessed via a connection with a name and password, then all related locations should return the same object. When the user switches to a location in a different group: then the former group's dispose() method is called.

        This may return null if the IOLocationGroup is not necessary.

        Overrides:
        getGroup in class IOLocation
        Returns:
        a IOLocationGroup for this resource
